intro: Aegiphila froesii, commonly known as the Brazilian corydalis, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, tubular, and typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters. Aegiphila froesii is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
